org.bytedeco.arrow_flight

Class FlightServerBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.arrow_flight.FlightServerBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    @Namespace(value="arrow::flight")
 @NoOffset
 @Properties(inherit=arrow_flight.class)
public class FlightServerBase
extends Pointer
    \brief Skeleton RPC server implementation which can be used to create custom servers by implementing its abstract methods

      • Init

        @ByVal
public Status Init(@Const @ByRef
                           FlightServerOptions options)
        \brief Initialize a Flight server listening at the given location. This method must be called before any other method.
        Parameters:
        options - [in] The configuration for this server.

      • port

        public int port()
        \brief Get the port that the Flight server is listening on. This method must only be called after Init(). Will return a non-positive value if no port exists (e.g. when listening on a domain socket).

      • SetShutdownOnSignals

        @ByVal
public Status SetShutdownOnSignals(@StdVector
                                           IntPointer sigs)
        \brief Set the server to stop when receiving any of the given signal numbers. This method must be called before Serve().

      • SetShutdownOnSignals

        @ByVal
public Status SetShutdownOnSignals(@StdVector
                                           IntBuffer sigs)

      • SetShutdownOnSignals

        @ByVal
public Status SetShutdownOnSignals(@StdVector
                                           int[] sigs)

      • Serve

        @ByVal
public Status Serve()
        \brief Start serving. This method blocks until either Shutdown() is called or one of the signals registered in SetShutdownOnSignals() is received.

      • GotSignal

        public int GotSignal()
        \brief Query whether Serve() was interrupted by a signal. This method must be called after Serve() has returned.
        Returns:
        int the signal number that interrupted Serve(), if any, otherwise 0

      • Shutdown

        @ByVal
public Status Shutdown()
        \brief Shut down the server. Can be called from signal handler or another thread while Serve() blocks. TODO(wesm): Shutdown with deadline

      • Wait

        @ByVal
public Status Wait()
        \brief Block until server is terminated with Shutdown.

        \brief Retrieve a list of available fields given an optional opaque criteria
